ticket.title: boot.rb accidental assignment?
ticket.original-body:
I am using Rails 2.3.2. with NetBeans IDE 6.5.1. The following message shows in the Task Window List.
Accidental assignment? (if x = y instead of x ==y) for boot.rb line 59
Looking at boot.rb:
@@@ ruby def load_rails_gem if version = self.class.gem_version gem 'rails', version else gem 'rails' end @@@
Should the if line be this?
@@@ ruby if version == self.class.gem_version @@@
Thanks, Tom

ticket.original-body-html:
I am using Rails 2.3.2. with NetBeans IDE 6.5.1. The following message shows in the Task Window List.

Accidental assignment? (if x = y instead of x ==y) for boot.rb line 59

Looking at boot.rb:


    def load_rails_gem
      if version = self.class.gem_version
        gem 'rails', version
      else
        gem 'rails'
      end

Should the if line be this?


      if version == self.class.gem_version

Thanks, Tom

version.body:
I am using Rails 2.3.2. with NetBeans IDE 6.5.1. The following message shows in the Task List Window.
Accidental assignment? (if x = y instead of x ==y) for boot.rb line 59
Looking at boot.rb: @@@ ruby def load_rails_gem if version = self.class.gem_version gem 'rails', version else gem 'rails' end @@@
Should the if line be this? @@@ ruby if version == self.class.gem_version @@@
Thanks, Tom
version.body-html:
I am using Rails 2.3.2. with NetBeans IDE 6.5.1. The following message shows in the Task List Window.

Accidental assignment? (if x = y instead of x ==y) for boot.rb line 59

Looking at boot.rb:

    def load_rails_gem







  if version = self.class.gem_version
    gem 'rails', version
  else
    gem 'rails'
  end</code>

Should the if line be this?

      if version == self.class.gem_version

Thanks,
Tom
version.title: boot.rb accidental assignment?

version.body:
This is intentional, I guess.
Variable assignment is evaluated as expression, and have its assigned value all the time. It seems there is no method named version(), so useing == here will raise the NameError. A version here is local variable to cache the result of self.class.gem_version, and pass it to gem() method as second argument if that is not nil (nor false).
version.body-html:
This is intentional, I guess.

Variable assignment is evaluated as expression, and have its
assigned value all the time. It seems there is no method named
version(), so useing == here will raise the NameError. A version
here is local variable to cache the result of
self.class.gem_version, and pass it to gem() method as second
argument if that is not nil (nor false).
version.title: boot.rb accidental assignment?
